snippet: The cuts, which have left many low-income women with inconvenient or costly options for treatment, grew out of a plan to eliminate state support for Planned Parenthood.
abstract: Republican-controlled Legislature in Texas has cut financing for women's health by two-thirds, leaving many low-income women with inconvenient or costly options for treatment; law, intended to eliminate state support for Planned Parenthood, also forces other clinics not affiliated with the agency to close; supporters say cutbacks were motivated by the fight against abortion but none of the clinics, even the ones run by Planned Parenthood, performed abortions.

byline.original: By PAM BELLUCK and EMILY RAMSHAW

lead_paragraph: The cuts, which have left many low-income women with inconvenient or costly options for treatment, grew out of a plan to eliminate state support for Planned Parenthood.

headline.seo: Texas Women’s Clinics Retreat as Finances Are Cut
headline.main: Women in Texas Losing Options for Health Care in Abortion Fight
headline.print_headline: Women in Texas Losing Options For Health Care
